Style Guide

Build

This blog is built with Jekyll and hosted on GitHub.

https://github.com/benjystanton/benjystanton.github.io

Fonts

  • Base font family: Source Sans
  • Heading font: Quatro Slab Ultra Black

  • Text
  • Dark grey
  • Medium grey

Small heading (h4)

A paragraph (from the Greek paragraphos, ‚Äúto write beside‚Äù or ‚Äúwritten beside‚Äù) is a self-contained unit of a discourse in writing dealing with a particular point or idea. A paragraph consists of one or more sentences. Though not required by the syntax of any language, paragraphs are usually an expected part of formal writing, used to organize longer prose.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adip*isicing elit, sed do eiusmod * tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

An example link

  • This is a list item in an unordered list
  • An unordered list is a list in which the sequence of items is not important. Sometimes, an unordered list is a bulleted list. And this is a long list item in an unordered list that can wrap onto a new line.
  • This is the last list item
  1. This is a list item in an ordered list
  2. An ordered list is a list in which the sequence of items is important. An ordered list does not necessarily contain sequence characters.
  3. This is the last list item

Blockquote

> A blockquote is a quotation in a written document, that is set off from the main text as a paragraph, or block of text, and typically distinguished visually using indentation.
<br>‚Äî Homer Simpson

A blockquote is a quotation in a written document, that is set off from the main text as a paragraph, or block of text, and typically distinguished visually using indentation.
‚Äî Homer Simpson

Post meta

Slightly smaller, slightly lighter text.

<p class="post-meta">9 Jan 2018</p>

9 Jan 2018

Big numbers

Use the big-number.html include.

include big-number.html
big-number="979"
text="miles driven"

979 miles driven

27 miles walked

Symbols

  • non-breaking space &nbsp; ¬†
  • en dash &ndash; ‚Äì
  • em dash &mdash; ‚Äî
  • horizontal ellipsis &hellip; ‚Ä¶
  • times (multiply) symbol &times; √ó
  • minus symbol &minus; ‚àí

Images

Images are full width by default. Don‚Äôt forget alt text.

  • Standard blog image: 1024 √ó 512
  • Thumbnail (for Twitter summary card): 500 √ó 500
![Alt text](path/to/image.png)

SVGs

I‚Äôve made the SVGs extra accessible by using L√©onie Watson‚Äôs accessible SVGs technique.

  • use role="img" so that SVGs are exposed to assistive technology like screen readers
  • use the SVG‚Äôs <title> tag together with aria-labelledby to expose the name to assistive technology
<svg width="165" viewBox="0 0 320 104">
<g role="img" aria-labelledby="logo-title">
<title id="logo-title">Benjy Stanton</title>
...
</g>
</svg>

Emoji (work in progress)

Use the emoji.html include, so that we can add some alt text. Technique inspired by L√©onie Watson.

include emoji.html
emoji="üí©"
alt-text="Pile of poo"
  • üí©
  • üëª
  • ü§ñ

Icons

I‚Äôm phasing out these icons. They‚Äôre not ideal because the mark-up uses the <i> tag. I also plan to use SVG icons in future. These are PNGs.

<i class="icon icon-social icon-instagram">
<span class="visuallyhidden">Instagram</span>
</i>

Tables

HTML tables

<table>
  <caption><h4>This is a table caption</h4></caption>
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>Table Heading</th>
      <th>Table Heading</th>
      <th class="cell--right">Numbers</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>Table Cell</td>
      <td>Table Cell</td>
      <td class="cell--right">1</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>Table Cell</td>
      <td>Table Cell</td>
      <td class="cell--right">12</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

This is a table caption
Table Heading Table Heading Numbers
Table Cell Table Cell 1
Table Cell Table Cell 12

Markdown tables

| Tables        | Are           | Cool  |
| ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
| col 3 is      | right-aligned | $1600 |
| col 2 is      | centered      |   $12 |
Tables Are Cool
col 3 is right-aligned $1600
col 2 is centered $12
